revised_title: Hydrogen Bond Behavior and Thermal Properties in KH2PO4 and KH2AsO4 Crystals
tldr: The authors studied the behavior of hydrogen bonds in crystals of KH2PO4 and KH2AsO4 at low temperatures. They discovered that these crystals undergo a phase transition, changing from a single crystal to a hybrid crystal composed of subcrystalline units. This transition occurs continuously over a range of temperatures, providing new insights into the thermodynamics of crystals and their phase changes.
